document.masterDocTitle: Haasea Verhoeff, 1895 - a genus of tumultuous history and chaotic recordsredefinition, revision of taxonomy and geographic distributions, with descriptions of two new species from Austria and Serbia (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida, Haaseidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Haasea Verhoeff, 1895 - a genus of tumultuous history and chaotic recordsredefinition, revision of taxonomy and geographic distributions, with descriptions of two new species from Austria and Serbia (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida, Haaseidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Strasser, K.
bibRefCitation.refString: Strasser, K. (1971) Uber Diplopoden Jugoslawiens. Senckenbergiana biologica, 52 (3 - 5), 313 - 345.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Differs from the other congeners, with exception of
H. intermedia
,
H. lacusnigri
,
H. makarovi
sp. nov.
and
H. plasana
, by the presence of a strongly developed anterior lateral process on angioxocite. From
H. lacusnigri
,
H. microcorna
differs by 1) shape of the anterior lateral process (straight in
H. microcorna
vs. robust, posterior end strongly bent distad in
H. lacusnigri
), 2) size and shape of posterior lamella (well-developed, bent down into an extension in
H. microcorna
vs. poorly developed, vestigial in
H. lacusnigri
), 3) size of the posterior lateral process (small in
H. microcorna
vs. strongly developed and curved posteriad in
H. lagusnigri
) or 4) size of mesal process (small in
H. microcorna
vs. strongly developed in
H. lacusnigri
). From
H. makarovi
sp. nov.
,
H. microcorna
differs by the 1) size and shape of mesal process (small, without teeth in
H. microcorna
vs. robust, with teeth in
H. makarovi
sp. nov.
), 2) size of posterior lateral process (small in
H. microcorna
vs. well-developed in
H. makarovi
sp. nov.
) 3) size and shape of posterior lamella (well-developed, bent down into an extension in
H. microcorna
vs. small, vestigial in
H. makarovi
sp. nov.
).
H. microcorna
seems to be the most similar with
H. plasana
and H. inter- media . From
H. plasana
,
H. microcorna
differs by the shape of the anterior lateral process (simple in
H. microcorna
vs. distally bifurcated in
H. plasana
). From
H. intermedia
,
H. microcorna
differs only in size and shape of posterior lamella (shorter and bent down into an extension in
H. microcorna
vs. long and parallel with distal half of angiocoxite until the base in
H. intermedia
), or by the geographic area (
H. microcorna
presents in the Dinarides vs.
H. intermedia
presents in the Carpatho-Balkan arc).

Topotype material examined:
SERBIA : 6 ♂♂ , 6 ♀♀ (alcohol material, one ♂ for SEM), Ušačka Cave , village of Ušak , near Sjenica , pit-fall traps 20.05–
30.08.2002
, D. Pavićević & S. Ognjenović leg., S. Makarov det. ( IZB )
, one microslide with topotypes, 1 ♂ (gonopods, pleurotergite 7),
1 ♀ (vulvae, leg-pair 3), same data as previous ( IZB )
;
4 ♂♂ (habitus picture), Ušačka Cave , village of Ušak near Sjenica , pit-fall traps collected on
22.10.2016
, M. Kuraica leg. ( IZB )
,
1 juvenile , same locality,
May 2016
( IZB )
.

Other material examined:
SERBIA : 3 ♂♂ , 3 ♀♀ , 1 juvenile ♂ (alcohol material), Tubića Cave , village of Tubići , near Sjenica , pit-fall traps 28.05–
30.08.2002
, D. Pavićević & S. Ognjenović leg. S. Makarov det. ( IZB )
, 1 ♂ microslide (gonopods),
1 ♀ microslide (vulvae, head, leg-pair 3, pleurotergites 1–8), same data as previous, S. Makarov det. ( IZB )
;
5 ♂♂ , 6 ♀♀ (alcohol material), Baždarska Cave , village of Ursule , near Sjenica , pit-fall traps 28.05–
29.08.2002
, D. Pavićević & S. Ognjenović leg., S. Makarov det. ( IZB )
, one microslide with 1 ♂ (gonopods, head, pleurotergites),
1 ♀ (vulvae, leg-pair 3), same data as previous, S. Makarov det. ( IZB )
;
1 juvenile , Baždarska Cave , village of Ursule , near Sjenica ,
17.08.2006
( IZB )
,
12 ♂♂ , 5 ♀♀ , same locality,
10.05.2016
, S. Li leg. ( IZB )
;
1 ♂ , 3 ♀♀ , Pećina u Potkapilijama Cave , village of Trudovo , Javor Mt. ,
01.05.2003
( IZB )

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 20.
Haasea microcorna ( Strasser, 1971 )
, topotype males (IZB). A. Left anterior gonopod, lateral view. B. Left anterior gonopod, mesal view. C. Left anterior gonopod, detail of distal part, lateral view. D. Left anterior gonopod, detail of distal part, mesal view. E. Right posterior gonopod, mesal view. F. Left posterior gonopod, mesal view. G. Left posterior gonopod, anterior view. Abbreviations: a —angiocoxite; ab —anterior branch; alp —anterior lateral process; cp —coxal process; dp —distal part; mb —medial branch; mdl —mesodistal lobe; ml —“
Opuntia
-like” membranous lobe; mp —mesal process; pb —posterior branch; pc —papillated cone; pl —posterior lamella; plp —posterior lateral process; t —telopodite. Scale bars: 0.1 mm ( A , B , E–G ), 0.05 mm (C , D) .

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution ( Figs 38 , 42 ). Serbia : Uvačka Cave, near Ušak ( Strasser 1971 ; Makarov 2008 ; present study), Tubića Cave, neat Tubići ( Makarov 2008 ), Baždarska Cave, near Ursule ( Makarov 2008 ; present study), Pećina u Potkapilijama Cave, near Trudovo (present study).

Type locality.
Ušačka Cave , village of Ušak , near Sjenica in Serbia
.

Comments. Originally described as a subspecies
H. lacusnigri microcornum
then it was raised to species level by Makarov (2008) . In his original description, Strasser (1971) did not point to the presence of a posterior lateral process (= “Cornicle”) in
H. microcorna
. This was already observed by Makarov (2008) and confirmed here in all examined topotypes and specimens from the other three caves as the posterior lateral process is always present.
